SEARCH
Package com.simcraft.graphics

Class HorizontalScrollingBackground

java.lang.Object
com.simcraft.graphics.HorizontalScrollingBackground
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updateable
public class HorizontalScrollingBackground extends Object implements Updateable, Renderable
Represents a background image that scrolls seamlessly in a horizontal direction. This effect is achieved by rendering two identical images, positioned to create a continuous loop as they are translated horizontally.

  • Constructor Details

    • HorizontalScrollingBackground

      public HorizontalScrollingBackground(String imageFilepath, int initialX, int initialY, int scrollSpeed, GamePanel gamePanel)
      Constructs a HorizontalScrollingBackground object.
      Parameters:
      imageFilepath - The file path to the background image.
      initialX - The initial x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the first background image.
      initialY - The initial y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the first background image.
      scrollSpeed - The base speed of scrolling. The sign determines the actual scrolling direction.
      gamePanel - The game panel on which this background is drawn. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if gamePanel is null.

    • HorizontalScrollingBackground

      public HorizontalScrollingBackground(String imageFilepath, int x, int y, GamePanel panel)
      Constructs a non-scrolling HorizontalScrollingBackground object.
      Parameters:
      imageFilepath - The path to the background image file.
      x - The initial x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the image.
      y - The initial y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the image.
      panel - The GamePanel on which this background is drawn. Cannot be null.

  • Method Details

    • getScrollSpeedX

      public int getScrollSpeedX()
      Gets the current horizontal scroll speed.
      Returns:
      The horizontal scroll speed in pixels per frame.

    • getBackgroundX

      public int getBackgroundX()
      Gets the current horizontal position of the background.
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate of the first background image.

    • getBackgroundY

      public int getBackgroundY()
      Gets the current vertical position of the background.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate of the first background image.

      public int getImageHeight()

      public int getLevelRightBoundary()
      Gets the right boundary of the level.
      Returns:
      The right boundary in pixels.

    • setScrollSpeed

      public void setScrollSpeed(int scrollSpeed)
      Sets the scrolling speed for the horizontal direction.
      Parameters:
      scrollSpeed - The new horizontal scrolling speed in pixels per frame. Positive means scrolling right, negative means scrolling left.

    • setPlayerX

      public void setPlayerX(int playerX)
      Sets the current horizontal position of the player. This is used to determine when to start or stop the background scrolling based on a threshold.
      Parameters:
      playerX - The player's current horizontal position in the game world.

    • setLevelRightBoundary

      public void setLevelRightBoundary(int levelRightBoundary)
      Sets the right boundary of the level.
      Parameters:
      levelRightBoundary - The right boundary in pixels.

    • setImage

      public final void setImage(String imageFilepath)
      Loads and sets the background image from a file path.
      Parameters:
      imageFilepath - The file path to the background image. If loading fails, an error is logged, and image dimensions are set to zero.

    • setImage

      public final void setImage(BufferedImage image)
      Sets the background image using a pre-loaded BufferedImage.
      Parameters:
      image - The pre-loaded background image. If null, an error is logged, and image dimensions are set to zero.

    • setLevelWidth

      public void setLevelWidth(int levelWidth)
      Sets the total width of the level in pixels.
      Parameters:
      levelWidth - The total width of the level in pixels.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the position of the background images to create the infinite horizontal scrolling effect based on the current horizontal scroll speed.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Updateable

    • render

      public void render(Graphics2D g2d)
      Draws the two instances of the background image onto the provided Graphics2D context. The second image is drawn to create the seamless horizontal scrolling illusion.
      Specified by:
      render in interface Renderable
      Parameters:
      g2d - The Graphics2D object used for drawing. The background is only drawn if the image has been loaded successfully.
